recommendation.Name: Email OTP
recommendation.Summary: With email OTP, org members can collaborate with anyone in the world by simply sharing a link or sending an invitation via email. Invited users prove their identity by using a verification code sent to their email account
recommendation.Recommendation: Enable email OTP

recommendation.Name: Trusted networks
recommendation.Summary: Trusted network is a signal leveraged by identity protection to improve risk detection. Defining your trusted networks will improve detection of risk events
recommendation.Recommendation: Define trusted networks

recommendation.Name: Conditional Access Controls (network, device and/or risks)
recommendation.Summary: Protect your users sign-ins by applying conditional access policies including risk, device or network location controls to improve your security
recommendation.Recommendation: Design conditional access to include risk, device and/or netowrk location conditions

recommendation.Name: Programatic usage of password credentials
recommendation.Summary: Application or Service Principals using password is discouraged to enforce the lifecycle of credentials
recommendation.Recommendation: Use managed identities, Windows Integrated Authentication or certificate whenever possible

recommendation.Name: Application or Service Principals with expired credentials
recommendation.Summary: Application or Service Principals credential lifecycle should be managed
recommendation.Recommendation: Review application or service principals with expired credentials

recommendation.Powershell: param($Data) # Select high permisions grants # high permissions = Mail or ReadWrite permissions # filtering out microsoft and office demo tenant $highPermissionsGrants = @($Data["ConsentGrantReport.csv"] | where { $_.permission -match "ReadWrite|Mail" -and $_.clientOwnerTenantId -notin ("72f988bf-86f1-41af-91ab-2d7cd011db47","a942cf59-f3c6-4338-acac-d26c18783a46") }) if ($highPermissionsGrants.Count -gt 0) { return "P2" } return "Passed"
recommendation.Name: Grants for high level permissions
recommendation.Summary: Application can request high level permission trough fishing. Such permissions include those allowing "ReadWrite" actions or "Mail" operations. Regular reviews should be in place and non-necessary grants should be removed
recommendation.Recommendation: Review applications having high permissions and remove unnecessary grants

recommendation.Powershell: param($Data) # Select grants to deprecated resource (Azure AD Graph) $highPermissionsGrants = @($Data["ConsentGrantReport.csv"] | Where-Object { $_.resourceObjectId -eq "369aeace-0da3-434f-a94b-cdd518008814" }) if ($highPermissionsGrants.Count -gt 0) { return "P2" } return "Passed"
recommendation.Name: Grants to legacy resources
recommendation.Summary: Grants are present to resources that are being deprected (Azure AD Graph)
recommendation.Recommendation: Review applications relying on these resources and review potential migration path with developer

recommendation.PowerShell: param($Data) # TODO: check if ELM is used or not $userAppAssignments = @($Data["appRoleAssignments.csv"] | Where-Object { $_.principalType -eq "User" }) if ($userAppAssignments.Count -gt 0) { return "P3" } return "Passed"
recommendation.Name: User App Assignments
recommendation.Summary: Direct assignment to user is not advisable when attestation to applications is not used
recommendation.Recommendation: Assign application roles to groups to have more flexibility

recommendation.Name: Assignment of Apps with "All users" group
recommendation.Summary: The "All users" group contains both Members and Guests. Resource owners might misunderstand this group to contain only members. As a result, special condsideration should be takeb when using this group for application assignment or grant access tor resource such as SharePoint Content or Azure resources
recommendation.Recommendation: Fix the entittlements by creating the right groups (e.g. "all members")

recommendation.PowerShell:
param($Data) # filter enabled policies $enabledCAPolicies = @($Data["conditionalAccessPolicies.json"] | Where-Object { $_.state -eq "enabled"})
$requireMFACAPolicies = @($enabledCAPolicies | Where-Object { $null -ne $_.grantControls -and $_.grantControls.builtInControls -contains "mfa" })
if ($requireMFACAPolicies.Count -eq 0) { return "P2" }
return "Passed"
recommendation.Name: Control MFA trough Conditional Access
recommendation.Summary: MFA can be condigured per user or on a federated Identity Provider. Applying MFA protection trough Conditional Access provides more flexibility
recommendation.Recommendation: Configure authentication policies to leverage MFA requirement via conditional access

recommendation.Name: Device Trust Access Policies
recommendation.Summary: Authenticating devices and account for its trust type improves your security posture and usability by avoiding friction (e.g. MFA) and blocking access to untrusted devices
recommendation.Recommendation: Use hybrid azure ad joined or compliant devices as a control in conditional access policies

recommendation.Name: Risk-Based Access Policies
recommendation.Summary: Azure AD Calculates risk for every sign-in and every user. Using risk as criteria in access policies can provide a better user experience (fewer authentication prompts), better security (only prompt user when needed) and automate remediation.
recommendation.Recommendation: Use sign-in or user risk controls in conditional access policies

recommendation.Name: Client Application Access Policies
recommendation.Summary: Microsoft Intune Appliucation Management (MAM) provides the ability to push data protection controls to compatible client mobile applications such as Outlook. Conditional Access can enforce policies that will restrict access to cloud services from approved and/or compatible apps
recommendation.Recommendation: Deploy application MAM policies to manage application configuration. Update Conditional Access policies to only allow access from MAM capables clients.

recommendation.Name: Exclusions usage
recommendation.Summary: Policies should all have an exclusion (User/Group/Role)
recommendation.Recommendation: Exclude at least one group from every policy

recommendation.Name: Only Users Excluded
recommendation.Summary: Excluding groups provide more flexibility to manage exclusions
recommendation.Recommendation: Put excluded users in a group and exclude the group

recommendation.Name: Groups and Users Excluded
recommendation.Summary: Excluding groups provide more flexibility to manage exclusions
recommendation.Recommendation: Put excluded users in an existing excluded group or create a new group to be excluded

recommendation.Name: Only Users Included
recommendation.Summary: Including groups provide more flexibility to manage inclusions
recommendation.Recommendation: Put included users in a group and include the group

recommendation.Name: Only Users Included
recommendation.Summary: Including groups provide more flexibility to manage inclusions
recommendation.Recommendation: Put included users in an existing excluded group or create a new group to be included

recommendation.Name: Common Excluded Groups or Users
recommendation.Summary: A common set of users or groups should be excluded from the CA policies. These break glass accounts are meant to be used in case of lockout. Their usage should be monitored.
recommendation.Recommendation: Create a group that is excluded from every CA policies

recommendation.Name: Common Users excluded but not groups
recommendation.Summary: Excluding groups provide more flexibility to manage exclusions
recommendation.Recommendation: Put common excluded users into a group and exclude this group

recommendation.Name: Common Users and Groups are excluded
recommendation.Summary: Excluding groups provide more flexibility to manage exclusions
recommendation.Recommendation: Put common excluded users into a group and exclude this group

recommendation.Name: Block Legacy Authentication
recommendation.Summary: Legacy authentication should be blocked in Conditional Access as well as locked down at the source
recommendation.Recommendation: Create a conditonal access to block legacy authentication

recommendation.Name: Block policies for all cloud apps and all users
recommendation.Summary: Policies that block all users and all cloud apps pose a risk of locking out the your entire organisation
recommendation.Recommendation: Review these policies

recommendation.PowerShell:
param($Data)
# filter enabled policies $enabledCAPolicies = @($Data["conditionalAccessPolicies.json"] | Where-Object { $_.state -eq "enabled"})
$deviceStatenAllPolicies = @($enabledCAPolicies | Where-Object { # grantControls requires a device condition $null -ne $_.grantControls -and $_.grantControls.builtInControls -contains "compliantDevice" -and $_.conditions.applications.includeApplications -contains "All" -and $_.conditions.users.includeUsers -contains "All" })
if ($deviceStatenAllPolicies.Count -gt 0) { return "P1" }
return "Passed"
